parts: set the allowTransparent attribute of iframe in javascript
flattened: set the allowTransparent attribute of iframe in javascript

parts:
I'm sorry for any confusion, but there is no `allowTransparent` attribute for the `<iframe>` element. The attributes you can use to control the behavior of an `<iframe>` are mainly related to security and permissions, such as `allowfullscreen`, `allow`, and so on.

If you're looking to make the background of an iframe transparent, you would typically achieve that through CSS styles applied to the iframe's content. Here's an example:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Transparent IFrame Example</title>
</head>
<body>
    <iframe id="myIframe" src="https://www.example.com" width="600" height="400" frameborder="0"></iframe>

    <script>
        // Get a reference to the iframe element
        var iframe = document.getElementById("myIframe");

        // Set styles to make the iframe's background transparent
        iframe.style.backgroundColor = "transparent";
        iframe.style.border = "none"; // Optional: remove the border
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

In this example, the CSS styles applied to the iframe make its background transparent and remove any borders. The content inside the iframe would need to be styled separately to achieve the desired effect of transparency.

If you have a specific goal in mind, please provide more details, and I'd be happy to assist further.
